thread.title: Shia LaBeouf arrested for public drunkenness in Austin after jaywalking, police say
thread.title_full: Shia LaBeouf arrested for public drunkenness in Austin after jaywalking, police say | OregonLive.com

author: Associated Press
title: Shia LaBeouf arrested for public drunkenness in Austin after jaywalking, police say
text:
AUSTIN, Texas — Actor Shia LaBeouf has been charged with public intoxication after a jaywalking incident outside a bar in Austin, Texas.
LaBeouf, 29, was arrested on the misdemeanor charge at 7:33 p.m. Friday, the Austin Police Department said in a news release.
Austin police told KVUE-TV that the "Transformers" actor was arrested after he refused an order not to cross against a "Don't Walk" sign and became belligerent.
A witness, Noah Hubbard, told the station the actor was crossing the street to get to a bar. When police told him to stop, he "got all in the cops' face and they told him not to do that; he started cussing them out and stuff."
Jail records show the actor was booked into the Travis County Jail and released on his own recognizance. No attorney was listed on the record.
He was arrested in the city's Sixth Street entertainment district, where the Austin City Limits festival is taking place through Sunday.
His publicist did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the arrest.
LaBeouf previously made headlines with bizarre escapades — including yelling from the audience during a Broadway show and wearing a paper bag on his head to a movie premiere — and has been treated for an alcohol problem.
